intro: Helictotrichon namaquense, commonly known as the Namaqua grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and efficient water use. Helictotrichon namaquense is often found in rocky soils and is a common component of fynbos vegetation in its native range.
